column4: hi ... anyone knows how to blacklist libata and enable old ide on intrepid ... it's even possible ?
thats an odd request, for what reason
keep in mind that everything in ubuntu is setup to use the current libatar model
^^' ... cant read an old ide disk on intrepid, but can do it on my ipcop box (2.4) and wanted to ddrescue it ...
well, thats a different kernel - that shouldn't be anything to do with libata
how are you trying to access the disk in 8.10
what device file are you running it against ?
/dev/$what
ubuntu/sysrecue /dev/sdx  ... ipcop /devhdx
is the device removable or mounted in the chassis
internal (on an old nforce2 board)
is teh forcedeath drivers loaded ?
appears not (lsmod | grep '*force*') ... it is an WD400GB
worth loading the forcedeath drivers
also check if dmesg/var/log/syslog shows up the disk at boot time
it does ... i can acces other partition on the drive (witch is 'diying') but the 1st and the last are not accessible. I cant test forcedeath right now (its mounted on ipcop, but i take a look ...)
any idea why i cant acces theses partitions on ubuntu, but can copy around on ipcop ?
I'd guess (and it is just a guess) that the older 2.4 driver doesn't do any sort of error checking, where as teh new one may do and won't allow you to mount a damaged disk
but it tell me that the device does not exist (special device does not exist ... ) even if fdisk -l list every thing ... ???
thats still driver access
well ... any way thks for the hint ;) gonna look further ...
no poroblem, but I really don't think it has anything to do with libata (to save time wasting)
ok (thks for save me some time and maybe my conf ;) )... i just finished dl Acc-Knoppix, maybe it use the old one ...
